title: What are the best image recognition apps? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the field of machine vision, image recognition refers to the ability of the program to recognize images of products, scenery, individuals, objects, etc. Machine vision technologies combine device cameras and artificial intelligence algorithms to accurately recognize images to guide autonomous robots and vehicles or perform other tasks ( e.g., image content searching). We've seen many apps that are powered by image recognition technologies that appeared in the market in 2019- 2020 and many are coming daily. For reader’s convenience, here I am sharing best Image Recognition Apps that can recognize 99 of 100 times correctly TruePicShop - Advanced AI-Powered Image Recognition Social Networking Platform. By using TruePicShop mobile app, you can search product by Image, shopping with image search, Shopping with Image Recognition, find similar items by photos, Image Recognition Social Networking App TruePicShop Inc. is a San Jose based tech company aimed at revolutionizing the shopping experience for people across the nation and around the world. Our image recognition application provides a fast and convenient way of searching for products. At the same time, it offers a solution for comparing prices across all e-commerce platforms. 2. Google Lens This fantastic app allows capturing images with a smartphone camera and then performing an image-based search on the web. It works just like Google Images reverse search by offering users links to pages, Wikipedia articles, and other relevant resources connected to the image. 3. ScreenShop This is an app for fashion enthusiasts who want to know where to get items they see on bloggers' photos, fashion models, and celebrities. The app essentially recognizes items that are shoppable in pictures, concentrating on clothes and accessories. 4. Flow Powered by Amazon Flow can recognize millions of items, such as DVDs and CDs, book covers, video games, and packaged household goods – the box of your favorite cereal for example. It also lets you scan business cards to easily add new people to your contacts. It also decodes UPC barcodes, QR codes, phone numbers, web and email addresses, and business card information. 5. Google Reverse Image Search This handy tool helps you look for images similar to the one you upload. Search results may include related images, sites that contain the image, as well as sizes of the image you searched for. It's very helpful for those who need a find higher-quality image on the web or look for something specific, like a particular cat breed.

It depends on the purpose. For example, optical character recognition for extracting text from a receipt is probably best done with a speciality, vertical app.  Whereas general purpose image recognition, something like Google Goggles, is much different.  Although, I think Goggles has been pulled from Google Play. As far as I know, there are no "really good" general purpose image recognition apps for search.  I spent a long time doing image recognition for brand promotions and retail marketing, our apps always had to be trained on specific images/products. That's the way it works for all of them, so far.  That said, I bet that in the future things like genre detection get better at helping to categorize, sort and aid in what appears to be general purpose image rec.
